newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar resumes downwards trend but trade thin.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar resumes downwards trend but trade thin.

text.p: White sugar futures again drifted lower on Wednesday morning but turnover stayed on the thin side with spreads holding broadly in line.
Traders said the gentle downward trend was likely to be maintained for the time being after light selling from funds eroded some October stops. Initial targets would be $321 and $320, they said.
At 1210 GMT October was down $1.30 at $323.90 and December down $1.20 at $320.90. Volume was just 340 lots.
On the fundamental side, Syria has tendered to buy 13,000 tonnes of white sugar for shipment between September 20 and October 20.
September 3 is set as the final date for receiving price offers with results to be made known a day later.
The Paris market was quiet ahead of the European Union's first sugar export licence tender of the new 1997/98 series.
A total of 84 lots of spot October were posted on the board. The contract was down 40 cents at $324.00. Nothing was traded on the lesser-quality 100 ICUMSA market.
